title: Incorporating Domain Knowledge into Deep Neural Networks
abstract:
Abstract
We present a survey of ways in which
domain-knowledge has been included when
constructing models with neural networks.
The inclusion of domain-knowledge is of
special interest not just to
constructing scientific assistants, but
also, many other areas that involve understanding data
using human-machine collaboration. In many
such instances, machine-based model construction
may benefit significantly from being provided with
human-knowledge of the domain encoded in a sufficiently precise
form. This paper examines two broad approaches to encode such
knowledge–as logical and numerical constraints–and describes
techniques and results obtained in several sub-categories under
each of these approaches.
